message.content: This question requires some basic understanding of adaptation and how animals respond to changes in climate. If a climate becomes colder over time, bears that grow a heavier pelt will survive. This is because a thicker and denser fur coat will provide better insulation and help them retain body heat in colder temperatures. Option (A) is incorrect because bears with sparse fur would not thrive in a colder climate. Option (B) is incorrect because bears with thin pelts would not have sufficient insulation in colder temperatures. Option (C) is incorrect because bears that carry little fat would not have adequate energy reserves to survive in a colder climate.

A thicker pelt provides better insulation and helps them retain body heat in cold temperatures. Option (A) is incorrect because bears with sparse fur would not thrive in a colder climate. Option (B) is also incorrect because bears with thin pelts would be more susceptible to the cold. Option (C) is incorrect because bears that carry little fat would not have enough energy reserves to survive in a colder climate.
